# MPMovieAccessLogEvent

**Class**

A single piece of information for a movie access log.

## Declaration

```swift
class MPMovieAccessLogEvent
```

## Overview

For a description of movie access logs, see [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMovieAccessLog].

## Movie access log event properties

- **numberOfSegmentsDownloaded**: A count of media segments downloaded from the web server to your app.
- **playbackStartDate**: The timestamp for when playback began for the movie log access event.
- **uri**: The URI of the playback item.
- **serverAddress**: The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the web server that was the source of the last delivered media segment.
- **numberOfServerAddressChanges**: A count of changes to the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPMovieAccessLogEvent/serverAddress] property over the last uninterrupted period of playback.
- **playbackSessionID**: A GUID that identifies the playback session to use in HTTP requests.
- **playbackStartOffset**: An offset into the playlist where the last uninterrupted period of playback began, in seconds.
- **segmentsDownloadedDuration**: The accumulated duration of the media downloaded, in seconds.
- **durationWatched**: The accumulated duration of the media played, in seconds.
- **numberOfStalls**: The total number of playback stalls encountered.
- **numberOfBytesTransferred**: The accumulated number of bytes transferred.
- **observedBitrate**: The empirical throughput across all media downloaded for the movie player, in bits per second.
- **indicatedBitrate**: The throughput required to play the stream, as advertised by the web server, in bits per second.
- **numberOfDroppedVideoFrames**: The total number of dropped video frames.

## Deprecated symbols

- **MPMovieAccessLog**: Key metrics about network playback for an associated movie player that’s playing streamed content.
- **MPMovieErrorLog**: Data describing network resource playback failures for the associated movie player, including timestamps indicating when each failure occurred.
- **MPMovieErrorLogEvent**: A single piece of information for a movie error log.
- **MPMovieLoadState**: Constants describing the network load state of the movie player.
- **MPMovieMediaTypeMask**: The types of content available in the movie file.
- **MPMoviePlayerController**: A type of movie player that manages the playback of a movie from a file or a network stream.
- **MPMoviePlayerViewController**: A simple view controller for displaying full-screen movies.
- **MPTimedMetadata**: A *timed metadata object that* carries time-based information within HTTP streamed media.
- **MPPlayableContentManager**: A shared content manager for controlling interactions between your media app and system-provided or external media player interfaces.
- **MPPlayableContentManagerContext**: An object representing the current state of the playable endpoint.
- **iPodMusicPlayer**: Returns the iPod music player, which controls the iPod app’s state.
- **init(image:)**: Initializes a media item artwork instance with a full-size image.
- **imageCropRect**: The bounds, in points, of the content area for the full size image associated with the media item artwork.
- **showsRouteButton**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the route button is visible in the volume view.
- **routeButtonImage(for:)**: Returns the button image associated with the specified control state.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
